intro: Chaetogastra pleromoides, commonly known as the common spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in cyathia, which are modified inflorescences typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
